channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Palestinians react to U.S. announcing the start of second phase of ceasefire in Gaza
item.description: Palestinians say they're suffering as they wait for progress in next phase of U.S.-backed ceasefire.
item.content:encoded: Palestinians say they're suffering as they wait for progress in next phase of U.S.-backed ceasefire.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Whiplash as addiction and mental health treatment gets cut and restored
item.description: Less than a day after the Trump administration slashed funding for addiction and mental health programs nationwide, the money was restored. Here's how this whiplash played out in Alabama.
item.content:encoded: Less than a day after the Trump administration slashed funding for addiction and mental health programs nationwide, the money was restored. Here's how this whiplash played out in Alabama.
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Uganda holds election day amid internet blackout
item.description: Uganda votes amid an internet blackout and heavy military deployment as President Yoweri Museveni seeks a seventh term, extending his four-decade grip on power
item.content:encoded: Uganda votes amid an internet blackout and heavy military deployment as President Yoweri Museveni seeks a seventh term, extending his four-decade grip on power
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: This teenager who wrote a research paper on how AI could impact teen jobs
item.description: A 17-year-old in California who got curious about the impact of AI on typical teen jobs. She embarked on an ambitious economic research project and shared her findings with us.
item.content:encoded: A 17-year-old in California who got curious about the impact of AI on typical teen jobs. She embarked on an ambitious economic research project and shared her findings with us.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Trump's threat to sanctuary cities highlights struggle over federal and local powers
item.description: As unrest continues in Minnesota, President Trump is threatening to cut money for sanctuary cities. That's a broad term that covers a battle between cities, states and the federal government.
item.content:encoded: As unrest continues in Minnesota, President Trump is threatening to cut money for sanctuary cities. That's a broad term that covers a battle between cities, states and the federal government.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Slotkin describes contact from federal prosecutor after video regarding illegal orders
item.description: The Justice Department is investigating Congress members after they were in a video telling members of the military they can reject illegal orders. Sen. Elissa Slotkin, D-Mich., is one of them.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department is investigating Congress members after they were in a video telling members of the military they can reject illegal orders. Sen. Elissa Slotkin, D-Mich., is one of them.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: State Department memo pauses immigrant visas for 75 countries
item.description: The Trump administration is pausing immigrant visa processing for nationals of 75 countries. Julia Gelatt of the Migration Policy Institute breaks down what the changes to immigration policy means.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is pausing immigrant visa processing for nationals of 75 countries. Julia Gelatt of the Migration Policy Institute breaks down what the changes to immigration policy means.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ofman

item.title: Trump's approach to the Department of Justice
item.description: The Justice Department is once again at the center of the news, with investigations of federal lawmakers, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, and resignations by career prosecutors in Minnesota.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department is once again at the center of the news, with investigations of federal lawmakers, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, and resignations by career prosecutors in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: If an Anne Boleyn portrait is really Elizabeth I, there's a good reason
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Tudor historian Owen Emmerson about his theory that the face in a famous portrait of Anne Boleyn is actually that of her daughter, Elizabeth I.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Tudor historian Owen Emmerson about his theory that the face in a famous portrait of Anne Boleyn is actually that of her daughter, Elizabeth I.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: The USS Ford crew is struggling with sewage problems on board the Navy's new carrier
item.description: Problems with the plumbing system on board America's newest aircraft carrier are getting worse. Issues with the toilets on the USS Ford continue even as it continues its deployment to the Caribbean.
item.content:encoded: Problems with the plumbing system on board America's newest aircraft carrier are getting worse. Issues with the toilets on the USS Ford continue even as it continues its deployment to the Caribbean.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh
